intro: Acrophorus nodosus, commonly known as the knotty acrophorus, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and dense, clustered leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is native to regions in Southeast Asia and is often found in humid, lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
